text: David asked, &#34Is there still anyone left of the house of Saul to whom I may show kindness for Jonathan&#39s sake?&#34
Now there was a servant of the house of Saul whose name was Ziba, and he was summoned to David. The king said to him, &#34Are you Ziba?&#34 And he said, &#34At your service!&#34

The king said, &#34Is there anyone remaining of the house of Saul to whom I may show the kindness of God?&#34 Ziba said to the king, &#34There remains a son of Jonathan; he is crippled in his feet.&#34
The king said to him, &#34Where is he?&#34 Ziba said to the king, &#34He is in the house of Machir son of Ammiel, at Lo-debar.&#34
Then King David sent and brought him from the house of Machir son of Ammiel, at Lo-debar.
Mephibosheth son of Jonathan son of Saul came to David, and fell on his face and did obeisance. David said, &#34Mephibosheth!&#34 He answered, &#34I am your servant.&#34

David said to him, &#34Do not be afraid, for I will show you kindness for the sake of your father Jonathan; I will restore to you all the land of your grandfather Saul, and you yourself shall eat at my table always.&#34
He did obeisance and said, &#34What is your servant, that you should look upon a dead dog such as I?&#34
Then the king summoned Saul&#39s servant Ziba, and said to him, &#34All that belonged to Saul and to all his house I have given to your master&#39s grandson.

You and your sons and your servants shall till the land for him, and shall bring in the produce, so that your master&#39s grandson may have food to eat; but your master&#39s grandson Mephibosheth shall always eat at my table.&#34 Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.
Then Ziba said to the king, &#34According to all that my lord the king commands his servant, so your servant will do.&#34 Mephibosheth ate at David&#39s table, like one of the king&#39s sons.
Mephibosheth had a young son whose name was Mica. And all who lived in Ziba&#39s house became Mephibosheth&#39s servants.
Mephibosheth lived in Jerusalem, for he always ate at the king&#39s table. Now he was lame in both his feet.
